me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.control

Class GenericTurnController

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.control.AbstractController
      • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.control.AngleDeltaController
        • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.control.GenericTurnController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class GenericTurnController
extends AngleDeltaController
    Provide a simple controller used for turns. This is an extension of the AngleDeltaController class.

    It's suggested you use one of the two static methods in this class to instantiate a GenericTurnController.

    • newController(double)
    • newInvertedController(double)
    If you create a controller using the first method (newController(double)) and notice that your robot is turning in the opposite direction than the robot should be turning in, use newInvertedController(double).

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericTurnController

        public GenericTurnController(double coefficient)
        Create a new GenericTurnController.
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the controller's coefficient. A higher coefficient means the robot will turn more quickly. A low coefficient means the robot will turn more slowly. You'll have to play around with this value until you get it right, but generally, this number should be around 0.01.

    • Method Detail

      • newController

        public static GenericTurnController newController(double coefficient)
        Create a new GenericTurnController.
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the controller's coefficient. A higher coefficient means the robot will turn more quickly. A low coefficient means the robot will turn more slowly. You'll have to play around with this value until you get it right, but generally, this number should be around 0.01.
        Returns:
        a new GenericTurnController.

      • newInvertedController

        public static GenericTurnController newInvertedController(double coefficient)
        Create a new, inverted GenericTurnController. Because this controller is inverted, it turns in the opposite direction a controller created with newController(double) would.
        Parameters:
        coefficient - the controller's coefficient. A higher coefficient means the robot will turn more quickly. A low coefficient means the robot will turn more slowly. You'll have to play around with this value until you get it right, but generally, this number should be around 0.01.
        Returns:
        a new GenericTurnController.
